{"Status": "Complete", "Paper Overview": {"type_of_reference": "JOUR", "Title": "Resolved galactic superwinds reconstructed around their host galaxies at z > 3", "authors": ["Chen, Mandy C.", "Chen, Hsiao-Wen", "Gronke, Max", "Rauch, Michael", "Broadhurst, Tom"], "author_address": ["AA(Department of Astronomy and Astrophysics, The University of Chicago, Chicago, IL 60637, USA), AB(Department of Astronomy and Astrophysics, The University of Chicago, Chicago, IL 60637, USA), AC(Department of Physics &amp; Astronomy, Johns Hopkins University, Baltimore, MD 21218, USA), AD(Carnegie Observatories, 813 Santa Barbara Street, Pasadena, CA 91101, USA), AE(Department of Theoretical Physics, University of the Basque Country UPV/EHU, Bilbao, E-48080, Spain; Donostia International Physics Center (DIPC), E-20018 Donostia, Spain; IKERBASQUE, Basque Foundation for Science, Bilbao, E-48011, Spain)"], "journal_name": "Monthly Notices of the Royal Astronomical Society", "volume": "504", "publication_year": "2021/06/1", "start_page": "2629", "end_page": "2657", "keywords": ["galaxies: evolution", "galaxies: high-redshift", "intergalactic medium", "galaxies: ISM", "galaxies: kinematics and dynamics", "Astrophysics - Astrophysics of Galaxies"], "url": "https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2021MNRAS.504.2629C", "abstract": "This paper presents a detailed analysis of two giant Lyman-alpha (Ly \u03b1) arcs detected near galaxies at z = 3.038 and z = 3.754 lensed by the massive cluster MACS 1206-0847 (z = 0.44). The Ly \u03b1 nebulae revealed in deep MUSE observations exhibit a double-peaked profile with a dominant red peak, indicating expansion/outflowing motions. One of the arcs stretches over 1 arcmin around the cluster Einstein radius, resolving the velocity field of the line-emitting gas on kpc scales around three star-forming galaxies of 0.3-$1.6\\, L_*$ at z = 3.038. The second arc spans 15 arcsec in size, roughly centred around two low-mass Ly \u03b1 emitters of $\\approx 0.03\\, L_*$ at z = 3.754. All three galaxies in the z = 3.038 group exhibit prominent damped Ly \u03b1 absorption (DLA) and several metal absorption lines, in addition to nebular emission lines such as $\\hbox{He ii}$$\\lambda \\, 1640$ and C III]\u03bb\u03bb1906, 1908. Extended Ly \u03b1 emission appears to emerge from star-forming regions with suppressed surface brightness at the centre of each galaxy. Significant spatial variations in the Ly \u03b1 line profile are observed which, when unaccounted for in the integrated line, leads to biased constraints for the underlying gas kinematics. The observed spatial variations indicate the presence of a steep velocity gradient in a continuous flow of high column density gas from star-forming regions into a low-density halo environment. A detailed inspection of available galaxy spectra shows no evidence of AGN activity in the galaxies, and the observed Ly \u03b1 signals are primarily explained by resonant scattering. The study presented in this paper shows that spatially resolved imaging spectroscopy provides the most detailed insights yet into the kinematics of galactic superwinds associated with star-forming galaxies.", "doi": "10.1093/mnras/stab1041", "custom1": "eprint: arXiv:2012.03959", "issn": "0035-8711", "number": "2"}, "ADS link": "https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2021MNRAS.504.2629C", "Publisher The white contours indicate the Ly\u2009\u03b1 emission associated with System A at a surface brightness of ${\\\\rm SB}_{{\\\\rm Ly}\\\\,\\\\alpha }=3.7\\\\times 10^{-18} \\\\, \\\\mathrm{erg \\\\, s^{-1} \\\\, cm^{-2} \\\\, arcsec^{-2}}$, integrated over the spectral window of 4890\u20134930 \u00c5 (see Section\u00a05.1 below). The surface brightness limit corresponds to a 3\u03c3 limiting flux over a circular aperture of 1 arcsec in diameter, roughly the size of the PSF measured in the MUSE data. The yellow contours show the critical curve of the cluster lens for a source at z\u00a0= 3.038. The left-hand panels show zoomed-in regions around lensed images of galaxies A1, A2, and A3, along with the Ly\u2009\u03b1 contours. Note that the galaxy A1 at z\u00a0= 3.0364 is magnified but not multiply lensed. Cluster member galaxy Gm1 is located close to lensed images of System A and is individually optimized in the lens modelling process as described in Section\u00a03. After correcting for the lensing magnification, the total Ly\u2009\u03b1 luminosity from the nebula is $L_{{\\\\rm Ly}\\\\,\\\\alpha }=(5.2\\\\pm 0.1)\\\\times 10^{42} \\\\, {\\\\rm erg\\\\, s^{-1}}$ (see Section\u00a05.1).\"}\r\n    </script>\r\n        <meta property=\"og:site_name\" content=\"OUP Academic\"/>\r\n        <meta property=\"og:type\" content=\"article\"/>\r\n        <meta property=\"og:title\" content=\"Resolved galactic superwinds reconstructed around their host galaxies at z &amp;gt; 3\"/>\r\n        <meta property=\"og:description\" content=\"ABSTRACT. The white contours indicate the Ly\u2009\u03b1 emission associated with System A at a surface brightness of ${\\rm SB}_{{\\rm Ly}\\,\\alpha }=3.7\\times 10^{-18} \\, \\mathrm{erg \\, s^{-1} \\, cm^{-2} \\, arcsec^{-2}}$, integrated over the spectral window of 4890\u20134930 &#197; (see Section&#160;5.1 below). The surface brightness limit corresponds to a 3\u03c3 limiting flux over a circular aperture of 1 arcsec in diameter, roughly the size of the PSF measured in the MUSE data. The yellow contours show the critical curve of the cluster lens for a source at z&#160;= 3.038. The left-hand panels show zoomed-in regions around lensed images of galaxies A1, A2, and A3, along with the Ly\u2009\u03b1 contours. Note that the galaxy A1 at z&#160;= 3.0364 is magnified but not multiply lensed. Cluster member galaxy Gm1 is located close to lensed images of System A and is individually optimized in the lens modelling process as described in Section&#160;3. After correcting for the lensing magnification, the total Ly\u2009\u03b1 luminosity from the nebula is $L_{{\\rm Ly}\\,\\alpha }=(5.2\\pm 0.1)\\times 10^{42} \\, {\\rm erg\\, s^{-1}}$ (see Section&#160;5.1).\"/>\r\n<meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"Chen, Mandy C\" /><meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Department of Astronomy and Astrophysics, The University of Chicago, Chicago, IL 60637, USA\" /><meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"Chen, Hsiao-Wen\" /><meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Department of Astronomy and Astrophysics, The University of Chicago, Chicago, IL 60637, USA\" /><meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"Gronke, Max\" /><meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Department of Physics\u00a0&amp; class=\"section-jump-link__link-wrap\">\r\n\r\n                <a class=\"js-jumplink scrollTo\" href=\"#246049574\">APPENDIX C: FITTING A SHELL MODEL TO STACKED SPECTRA OBTAINED OVER A LARGE AREA WITH FIXED INTRINSIC Ly\u2009\u03b1 LINE WIDTH \u03c3<sub><em>i</em></sub></a>\r\n            </div>\r\n        </li>\r\n        <li class=\"section-jump-link head-2\" link-destination=\"246049578\">\r\n            <div class=\"section-jump-link__link-wrap\">\r\n\r\n                <a class=\"js-jumplink scrollTo\" href=\"#246049578\">APPENDIX D: Ly\u2009\u03b1 LINE PROFILE FROM ACCELERATING AND DECELERATING EXPANDING CLOUDS</a>\r\n            </div>\r\n        </li>\r\n</ul>\r\n \r\n    </div>\r\n\r\n            </div>\r\n    <div class=\"widget last\">\r\n                            <a class=\"drop-trigger at-ShareButton\" href=\"javascript:;\" data-dropdown=\"ShareDrop\" aria-haspopup=\"true\">\r\n                                <i class=\"icon-menu_share\"></i>\r\n                                <div class=\"toolbar-label\">\r\n                                    <div class=\"toolbar-text\">Share</div>\r\n                                    <i class=\"icon-general-arrow-filled-down arrow-icon\"></i>\r\n                                </div>\r\n                            </a>\r\n                            <ul id=\"ShareDrop\" class=\"addthis_toolbox addthis_default_style addthis_20x20_style f-dropdown\" data-dropdown-content aria-label=\"submenu\">\r\n                                <div class=\"arrow-up\"></div>\r\n                                <li><a class=\"addthis_button_email\"><span>Email</span></a></li>\r\n                                <li><a class=\"addthis_button_twitter\"><span>Twitter</span></a></li>\r\n                                <li><a class=\"addthis_button_facebook\"><span>Facebook</span></a></li>\r\n                                <li><a class=\"addthis_button_compact\"><span>More</span></a></li>\r\n                            </ul>\r\n                        </li>\r\n                    </ul>\r\n                    <div class=\"toolbar-search\">\r\n    <div class=\"widget widget-SitePageHeader widget-instance-OUP_ArticleToolbarSearchBox\">\r\n        \r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n<div class=\"dropdown-panel-wrap\">\r\n\r\n    \r\n    <div class=\"dropdown-panel mobile-search-dropdown\">\r\n        <div class=\"mobile-search-inner-wrap\">\r\n                <div class=\"navbar-search\">\r\n                    <div id=\"MobileMicrositeSearch\" class=\"mobile-microsite-search\">\r\n                        <label for=\"mobile-navbar-search-filter\" class=\"screenreader-text\">Navbar Search Filter</label>\r\n                        <select class=\"mobile-navbar-search-filter\" id=\"mobile-navbar-search-filter\">\r\n                                                            <optgroup label=\"Search within this      </optgroup>\r\n                        </select>\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n                        <label for=\"MobileMicrositeSearchTerm\" class=\"screenreader-text\">Mobile Microsite Search Term</label>\r\n                        <input class=\"mobile-search-input mobile-microsite-search-term at-microsite-search-term\" type=\"text\" maxlength=\"255\" placeholder=\"Search\" id=\"MobileMicrositeSearchTerm\">\r\n\r\n                        <a href=\"javascript:;\" id=\"MobileMicrositeSearchIcon\" class=\"mobile-microsite-search-icon mobile-search-submit class=\"dropdown-panel mobile-account-dropdown\">\r\n        <ul class=\"site-menu site-menu-lvl-0\">\r\n            <li class=\"site-menu-item site-menu-lvl-0\">\r\n                <a href=\"\" class=\"nav-link mobile-account-signin js-nav-dropdown js-header-account-info-user-fullname\" id=\"header-account-info-user-fullname-mobile\">\r\n                    \r\nSign In                    <i class=\"mobile-nav-arrow icon-general_arrow-down\"></i>\r\n                </a>\r\n                <ul class=\"site-menu site-menu-lvl-1 individual-menu\">\r\n                    <li class=\"dropdown-signin-form\">\r\n                        <div class=\"spinner\"></div>\r\n                    </li>\r\n                </ul>\r\n            </li>\r\n                <li class=\"site-menu-item site-menu-lvl-0\">\r\n                        <a href=\"javascript:;\" class=\"nav-link mobile-account-institution js-nav-dropdown\">\r\n                            University of Utah\r\n                        </a>\r\n\r\n                    <i class=\"mobile-nav-arrow icon-general_arrow-down\"></i>\r\n                    <ul class=\"site-menu site-menu-lvl-1\">\r\n                            <li class=\"dropdown-institution-item\">\r\n\r\nUniversity of Utah\r\n                            </li>\r\n\r\n                        <li class=\"dropdown-institution-signout\">\r\n                        </li>\r\n                    </ul>\r\n                </li>\r\n                            <li class=\"site-menu-item\">\r\n                    <a href=\"/my-account/register?siteId=5326&amp;returnUrl=%2fmnras%2farticle%2f504%2f2%2f2629%2f6226641\" class=\"register nav-link\">Register</a>\r\n                </li>\r\n
